sections.heading: where
sections.content: I worked most of my life in the security industry. I would design camera layouts for customers and install everything. It felt good doing something to help protect people or the ability to catch criminals with our camera systems. After a few years, I decided it was time to see what else I could do. I worked for a company that use electric fences to keep criminals out, they also used security cameras but their main product was the electric fence. I learned a lot at this job and I traveled all over Texas and sometimes Louisiana. It was going well but I wanted to do something where I could grow. Field Technicians don’t have a lot of growth opportunities so it was time to get serious about changing my career. At this point, I had taken a few courses on Udemy and Codecademy. It was a slow process and I didn’t have a lot of guidance, but I knew I wanted to do this. An opportunity opened to attend Perpetual Education and I took it. Here I am with so much knowledge learned but more to learn.

sections.heading: why
sections.content: I’ve wanted to be a web developer for quite some time but spent a lot of years self-teaching myself with not a lot of success. I only knew about this field because I had friends that did it and they showed me what they do. It’s been a goal of mine to be able to have a career in the tech industry, especially as a web developer. Build websites that are clean and easy to navigate for the user. The ability to do something meaningful and also grow my career into any path I choose, is what I am building towards right now.

sections.heading: onward
sections.content: I will keep practicing and learning, I got the opportunity to do this and it's something that brings me joy to do.
